summary: This bill, the Water Intelligence, Security, and Cyber Threat Protection Act of 2025, aims to enhance the security and resilience of the nation's drinking water and wastewater systems. It mandates the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to establish a program to encourage participation in the Water Information Sharing and Analysis Center, offset membership costs for water systems, improve coordination on threat analysis, and enhance the Center's tools for monitoring and enhancing preparedness against cyber threats and natural hazards. The bill authorizes appropriations of $10 million annually for fiscal years 2026 and 2027.
